There's an unrelated `.decode("utf-8")` change.

The location fix looks good. Note that you can also write:

```
location = location or self.default_location
if location is None:
    raise ValueError("location is required.")
```

I almost forgot: Thank you for your contribution! It's great that you took the time to report this to libcloud. Even better: you included a fix! ‚ú®  I'm not a maintainer, just leaving notes to get this merged faster. It's terse and to the point, but does not mean that the contribution is not good or not appreciated. :)

Note that `GCEList` defines an `__iter__` method, so it would be simpler to write `for image in project_images_list:` and remove the `for image in page:`.

But your fix works too and is more explicit about the pagination! üëç
Thank you!

@pquentin Actually, pagination only works after calling the `page` method.

We need this:

https://github.com/apache/libcloud/blob/8bb7e0c4161b3d3478ee2c739a126b3da7f68f8b/libcloud/compute/drivers/gce.py#L305

so that this evaluates to true and we get pagination:

https://github.com/apache/libcloud/blob/8bb7e0c4161b3d3478ee2c739a126b3da7f68f8b/libcloud/compute/drivers/gce.py#L125

I can't speak for the original author, but it seems like that's how it was designed to work in 1ed50204

Oh, you're right, sorry! Got confused by the `return self` hack. I now understand that `__iter__` return sublists.

Hi pquentin,

The " unrelated .decode("utf-8") change" is part of another pull request that fixes a problem in

Hi pquentin,

The " unrelated .decode("utf-8") change" is part of another pull request that fixes another problem that was in the original pull request (1051). 

The error was: When using SSH key authentication, the randomly generated HEX password for admin account is encoded as bytes which results in a JSON serialization error.

The fix: Changed the encoding to UTF-8.
Pull request is covered by later pull request #1098. Closing this one.
Closed by mistake.

Thanks for your contribution and sorry for being late to the game.

I don't think removing this flag is a good idea - it will just mask real issues. Instead of removing this flag we should fix the actual root cause which is causing the warning.

I quickly checked the docs build locally and since we merged this change, quite some documentation "regressions" were introduced. We should fix all those issues and then re-enable the flag to make sure we won't commit and merge bad code into master again.

cc @tonybaloney

> libcloud/compute/drivers/azure_arm.py:1732:13: E129 visually indented line with same indent as next logical line

I read in PEP8 that:

Acceptable options in this situation include, but are not limited to:

```
# No extra indentation.
if (this_is_one_thing and
    that_is_another_thing):
    do_something()
```

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/13151045/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/13151045)

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/13151551/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/13151551)

Coverage remained the same at 88.97% when pulling **a0f6ece02501dd05cd449bed1fdbb520a4461157 on Kami:re_enable_sphinx_docs_strict_checks** into **f1bff48142bd942ce1e81abb9769be3dd09a3d76 on apache:trunk**.

1&1 driver had a lot of issues - 6fcd3487ece4fb0b2cbee535b4a20599ab2a591a.

We need to be more careful about the docstring syntax during code reviews and also look if we can build more automation around detecting invalid / broken docstring syntax. In this case, docstrings we syntactically correct, but not semantically so sphinx didn't detect more issues.

On a related note - the driver is also missing documentation / explanation for a lot of extension (ex_) arguments which should be mandatory.

Extension arguments / methods without documentation are basically useless - driver user still needs to go check the provider API docs, etc. so kinda defeats the purposes of ease of use.

@tonybaloney can you please look into updating coveralls setting so it only posts a comment once per PR instead of posting once after every push (aka update the existing comment instead of posting a new one).

If that's not possible with coveralls, we should consider switching to codecov.io which supports that functionality (we use it in StackStorm/st2). Right now the comments are too spammy - they don't add much value, just make it harder to see actual comments which might provide some actual value to the discussion.

Thank you @vongazman for your contribution. Great first-time GitHub contribution! The changes make perfect sense! üëç

However, this pull requests lacks tests. I realize that the existing `external_ip` parameter is not tested, but I believe you should add tests at least for `internal_ip`. You can look at the DimensionData tests to see how you can update the fixtures and test code to do that.

You're right: PEP8 accepts the E129 error, but the [pycodestyle linter does not by default](https://github.com/PyCQA/pycodestyle/issues/126), and it's probably a good thing. Thanks for updating your code!

The change make sense, and is documented: thanks for a great first-time contribution. I believe there are a few issues left.

 * Renaming the `private_ip_address` parameter to `ip_address` would be more consistent with most of the drivers. Not sure about prefixing `private_ip_allocation_method` with `_ex`.
 * Azure ARM appears to accept IPv6 addresses, so documenting the address to be IPv4 is too restricting.

Admittedly, those are nitpicks. But a more important issue: we need a test before we can merge this feature! `ex_create_network_interface` is not tested directly, but through  `test_create_node`. There's a fixture at `fixtures/azure_arm/_subscriptions_99999999_9999_9999_9999_999999999999_resourceGroups_000000_providers_Microsoft_Network_networkInterfaces_test_node_1_nic.json` that you should adapt to test using a static private IP.

Thanks!
@tonybaloney @Kami this pull request is ready to be merged.

@tonybaloney Nice thing about codecov also is that you don't need to configure hooks manually on Github.

It works "out of the box" for public repos which use Travis CI or a similar service.
